newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Wall St bounce lifts Australia stocks at open.
newsitem.headline: Wall St bounce lifts Australia stocks at open.

text.p: The Australian sharemarket firmed at the opening on Wednesday as a rebound on Wall Street saw a positive tone return to local markets.
At the opening, the All Ordinaries index was up 5.70 points at 2,268.0.
The September share index futures firmed eight points to 2,274 and was at a 6.0 point premium to the underlying index.
Brokers said the return of the long term bond rate to below seven percent had seen investors reassured after a hesitant two days' trading.
"The U.S. has helped to steady things up with bonds pushed back below seven percent reassuring some nervous people," said a Sydney broker.
While the broker saw a positive outlook, he was not expecting major moves during the day with a firmer finish rather than a strong march ahead expected.
"Locally we are still pretty sound, but I'm not expecting big things today," he said.
Results season continues with the early major results from base metals miner, Pasminco, whose shares were two cents firmer after a big jump in full year net profit to A$40.8 million.
Rises outnumbered falls by a ratio of about nine to five, while about 48 percent of stocks traded remained steady.
